DOT/PARSE.name: PARSE
DOT/PARSE.description: Police Accident Report Sampling Engine (PARSE) is a web application Production within CDAN to collect, manage, store and make available to CDAN data acquisition projects, Police Accident Reports (PAR) data collected via electronic or physical methods for the purposes of selection within a appropriate NHTSA data collection program.

DOT/CISSWeb.name: CISSWeb
DOT/CISSWeb.description: Crash Investigation Sampling System (CISS) Web (CISSWeb) application consists of motor vehicle crash and injury data collected from Police Accident Reports (PARS) gathered through a network of remote field sites around the country operated and managed under contract by NHTSA.  CISSWeb is the application that consolidates all the data collected within the lifecycle of the case, regardless of the source. Specific PARs are selected for followup investigation via a sample algorithm designed to target towed late model vehicle, specific injuries and/or crashes of special interest to NHTSA. In addition to PAR and injury data, field Data Technicians collect data by inspecting and recording damage to case vehicles, inspecting and collecting data from crash scenes and enhancing vehicle and scene data with digital imagery. When possible, contractors conduct occupant interviews.  NHTSA uses the CISS data collected to evaluate the conditions present at the time of the crash, injuries resulting from crashes, vehicle crashworthiness, special types of crashes (e.g., air bag deployment), and crashes of high public interest (e.g., school bus crashes).

DOT/iREx.name: iREx
DOT/iREx.description: iREx (integrated Risk Executive) is a NHTSA-developed  automated Risk Management system for its IT investments. It is compliant to federal regulations (implements NIST SP 800-37 Risk Management Framework guidance and processes) to ensure that Risk-based decision making is a tangible feature of the NHTSA risk management processes. It is collaboratively used by NHTSA's PMO, EA, CPIC and cybersecurity components in risk-based decisioning. iREx ensures that risk mitigation is linked to identifiable combinations of security issues that are recorded and managed in order to address and measure each relevant risk and vulnerability.  iREx is a web-based application with a SQL-based database back-end.  It has capabilities to generate Assessment and Analysis reports used to support DOT/NHTSA Risk Posture, and C&A of its IT systems.

DOT/NAF.name: NAF
DOT/NAF.description: NAF (NHTSA Asset Framework) is the NHTSA-developed system that serves as its IT Asset metadata management, analysis and reporting platform. This  includes  IT hardware, software assets information in the following contexts: technical specifications, licensing information, SLA management, capital planning, acquisition, and enterprise architecture (TRM).

DOT/MR%20Tool%20(SDAG).name: MR Tool (SDAG)
DOT/MR%20Tool%20(SDAG).description: MR Tool (Service Data Architecture Group Metadata Repository) is the NHTSA-developed DOT standard system that supports  DOT's continuing implementation of OMB M-13-13 (through DOT Order 1351.34) for DOT OA data and information to be disclosed rapidly in forms that the public can readily find and use.  As such, it is tailored as an analysis and reporting system holding metadata  describing DOT OA datasets, and is designed to conform to the latest federal Open Data metadata schema (https://project-open-data.cio.gov/v1.1/schema/).

DOT/TravelOnTrack.name: TravelOnTrack
DOT/TravelOnTrack.description: TravelOnTrack is used to track allocated agency travel budgets by office and fiscal year. It manages and tracks submitted travel proposals, plans and completed travel information, including associated budget and overage data. It enables transfer of unused funds in an office as necessary. TravelOnTrack generates summary reports on available funds and usage of approved/proposed travels and other travel-related reports.

DOT/SISAME.name: SISAME
DOT/SISAME.description: NHTSA funded the development of the SISAME program starting in the late 1980�s until the mid 2000�s.  This program provides a very unique capability for mass/spring multibody model extraction from test data.   NHTSA has discontinued support or development for the SISAME program

DOT/vPIC-List.name: vPIC-List
DOT/vPIC-List.description: The NHTSA Product Information Catalog and Vehicle Listing (vPIC) is a consolidated platform that presents data collected within the manufacturer reported data from CFR 49 Parts 551 � 574 for use in a variety of modern tools. NHTSA�s vPIC platform is intended to serve as a centralized source for basic Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) decoding, Manufacturer Information Database (MID), Manufacturer Equipment Plant Identification and associated data.  vPIC is primarily intended for use on Model Years 1995 forward. Data prior to 1995 may be available depending on the manufacturer, which is based on submittals received by NHTSA. This includes passenger vehicles, trucks, buses, trailers / trailer kits, incomplete vehicles, low speed vehicles and motorcycles to name a few as the primary categories. Vehicles within these major categories are further defined by the details provided by the manufacturers in accordance to reporting standards of CFR 49 Part 565 and 566.

DOT/Encyclopedia.name: Encyclopedia
DOT/Encyclopedia.description: This is the public website through which FARS traffic safety facts as well as query capability is made available

DOT/CISSForm.name: CISSForm
DOT/CISSForm.description: CISSForm is the CDAN implemenation of the commercial software developed by Mi-Co.  This application is used to perform offline data collection for vehicles involved in motor vehicle crashes within the CISS system.

permissions.exemptiontext: This is not applicable for open source

DOT/Crypto%20Service.name: Crypto Service
DOT/Crypto%20Service.description: A web service and windows app that encrypts and decrypts strings

DOT/FOIA.name: FOIA
DOT/FOIA.description: Freedom Of Information Act System manages initial FOIA requests and appeals submitted by the general public.

DOT/TFICS.name: TFICS
DOT/TFICS.description: Transportation Fellows Interns and Contractor System provides interfaces for the individuals and for the educational institutions who are interested to apply for the scholarship and granting programs offering through DOT Office of HR.

DOT/SFD.name: SFD
DOT/SFD.description: The SFD rulemaking is designed to enhance FMCSA�s ability to identify non-compliant motor carriers by using all available agency data

DOT/D%26ADB.description: Drug and Alcohol Clearinghouse Database will be used to store and transfer information about drug and alcohol program violations and Alpha results

DOT/ELD.description: Enforcement tool to read and analyse Hours of Service data read from Electronic Logging Devices

DOT/Aviation%20Environmental%20Design%20.description: AEDT is a software system that models aircraft performance in space and time to estimate fuel consumption, emissions, noise, and air quality consequences.

DOT/SafetyHAT.description: Database tool that facilitates implementing the System Theoretic Process Analysis (STPA) method.
DOT/SafetyHAT.vcs: Available as part of download (password protected)

DOT/Unmanned%20Aircraft%20Systems%20Regi.name: Unmanned Aircraft Systems Registration Service (UASRS)
DOT/Unmanned%20Aircraft%20Systems%20Regi.description: The Unmanned Aircraft Systems Registration Service (UASRS) is used by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to provide small Unmanned Aircraft System (sUAS) operators/owners a service to register all sUAS for the purpose of Production sUAS in U.S. air space. sUAS are defined as those aircraft that weigh more than 0.55 pounds but less than 55 pounds. This service educates new operators about airspace rules so they can use their unmanned aircraft safely. As part of the registration process, registrants acknowledge that they have read, understand, and intend to follow the safety guidance. The service allows the FAA to identify and take enforcement action against those who intentionally violate the rules or operate unsafely.
DOT/Unmanned%20Aircraft%20Systems%20Regi.vcs: Amazon EC2 is hosted in multiple locations worldwide. These locations are composed of regions and Availability Zones. Each region is a separate geographic area. Each region has multiple, isolated locations known as Availability Zones.

DOT/B4UFly.name: B4UFly
DOT/B4UFly.description: B4UFLY is a UAS Mobile Application that enables a small UAS or model aircraft operator the ability to check their current location for conformance with FAA published guidelines prior to flight operations.  This will assist model aircraft users to conform to Public Law 112-95, Section 336: Special Rule for Model Aircraft (FMRA) which outlines what a model aircraft is and how it can be legally operated within the national airspace.
DOT/B4UFly.vcs: General public can download this app from the App Store for iOS or Google Play store

DOT/EDAI.name: EDAI
DOT/EDAI.description: External Data Access Initiative (EDAi) provides the private sector greater access to core FAA data to spur more innovation in the aviation industry, and ultimately advance the FAA�s mission of safety in flight.  Based on stakeholder recommendations, this initiative�s first effort strived to provide both more data and better data for Aeronautical products and information.    Solution Delivery developed and deployed web services for several aeronautical products including both information about those products and the ability to automatically download those products which satisfied one of the recommendations.

DOED/OESE%20SharePoint%20Sites.description: The OESE SharePoint Project provides a centralized knowledge management system and portal to improve internal communication within OESE, provides OESE staff access to the right information when they need it, and enables collaboration among OESE staff.  The OESE SharePoint portal contains an organized, centralized and searchable repository of OESE-specific information that is not currently available elsewhere.  Items currently available on-line include leading indicators, OESE�s logic model toolkit, performance data, process maps, and information on internal OESE processes (e.g., standard operating procedures, templates, checklists, examples, best practices).

DOED/National%20Report%20System%20(NRS)%.description: Section 212 of Adult Education and Family Literacy Act, requires that ED establish a comprehensive performance accountability system for formula grantees to assess the effectiveness of adult education and literacy activities. NRS is the required system.

DOED/Literacy%20Information%20and%20Comm.name: Literacy Information and Communications System
DOED/Literacy%20Information%20and%20Comm.description: LINCS is a professional learning platform for adult educators.

DOED/Financial%20Aid%20Toolkit.name: Financial Aid Toolkit
DOED/Financial%20Aid%20Toolkit.description: The Financial Aid Toolkit provides important info and resources for HS counselors, TRIO/Gear Up staff, college access professionals, and other mentors/influencers who work with students and families on preparing for and funding a postsecondary education.

DOED/ADG%20Applications%20(ADGA).name: ADG Applications (ADGA)
DOED/ADG%20Applications%20(ADGA).description: The ADG Applications investment covers operations for 7 applications. It was downgraded in FY14 to non-major status due to DME funding cuts by the FSA IRB.  The BY2015 submission represents a revision to the investment that now includes DME.

DOED/Aid%20Data%20Mart%20(ADM).name: Aid Data Mart (ADM)
DOED/Aid%20Data%20Mart%20(ADM).description: The Aid Data Mart gathers summary and detail lending data  from FMS, NSLDS, and PEPS, and makes it available in both predefined reports and ad hoc inquiry formats to be used in program management and oversight activities.  It is scheduled to be decommissioned on 01/15/2017 as its functionality has been developed in the EDWA IT investment.

DOED/Application%20and%20Eligibility%20D.name: Application and Eligibility Determination System (AEDS)
DOED/Application%20and%20Eligibility%20D.description: The AEDS supports a large group of front end business functions associated with applying for federal student aid. The primary business function is application processing and eligibility determination.

DOED/Common%20Origination%20and%20Disbur.name: Common Origination and Disbursement (COD)
DOED/Common%20Origination%20and%20Disbur.description: Common processing platform for Federal student aid recipients at higher education institutions participating in Title IV aid programs to originate and disburse Title IV funds, including Pell Grants & Direct Loans. EDWA project added in FY14.

DOED/Debt%20Management%20and%20Collectio.name: Debt Management and Collections System (DMCS)
DOED/Debt%20Management%20and%20Collectio.description: The DMCS Investment supports a system that collects defaulted student debt through a number of means and returns the money to the Treasury.

DOED/eCampus%20Based%20System.description: The investment (eCampus-Based System) supports the activities that provide Campus-Based funds (Federal Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grant, Federal Work-Study, and Federal Perkins Loans) to Title IV eligible institutions.

DOED/EDExpress.name: EDExpress
DOED/EDExpress.description: EDE Suite is a suite of two free software products (EDExpress and Direct Loan Tools) provided by FSA to schools for their use in originating, disbursing, and packaging Title IV aid for students.

DOED/Integrated%20Student%20Experience%2.description: The Integrated Student Experience initiative is comprised of student websites, new media and mobile interfaces. EPA/My%20Right%20to%20Know%20(MyRTK).name: My Right to Know (MyRTK)
EPA/My%20Right%20to%20Know%20(MyRTK).description:
Source code and documentation for MyRTK.  
  
MyRTK is an EPA Web application designed for mobile devices. For any location or address, MyRTK maps nearby facilities that report to the Toxics Release Inventory (TRI), as well as large permit holders in EPA's Air, Water, or Hazardous Waste programs that are expected to produce, manage, or release TRI-reportable chemicals.  
  
This application compares toxic chemical releases from individual facilities to releases from other facilities in the same county, as well as to releases from other facilities in the same industry sector. MyRTK also identifies the most serious facility non-compliance across the twelve most recent quarters of data for the three main United States environmental statutes: the Clean Air Act, the Clean Water Act, and the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.

EPA/EPA%20Environmental%20Dataset%20Gate.name: EPA Environmental Dataset Gateway
EPA/EPA%20Environmental%20Dataset%20Gate.description: Source code for the EPA Environmental Dataset Gateway (EDG), an open-source metadata catalog built on Esri's Geoportal Server.

EPA/github_101.name: github_101
EPA/github_101.description: This repository contains introductory presentation materials on Git and Github. The two presentaitons provide a high level conceptual overview of version control with Git, basic concepts of Github, and a more hands-on example walking through the CMAQ repository and how Git and GitHub are used to manage open source development of the CMAQ models.

EPA/ArcGIS%20API%20for%20JavaScript.description: Learn More The ArcGIS API for JavaScript (JavaScript API) is a browser based API for developing high performance, easy to use mapping applications. The API allows you to easily embed maps in your Web pages. The JavaScript API is hosted by ESRI on ArcGIS Online and is available for free use, subject to the terms and conditions.

EPA/CompTox-Virtual-Tissues-livertox-crt.name: CompTox-Virtual-Tissues-livertox-crt
EPA/CompTox-Virtual-Tissues-livertox-crt.description: This repository contains supporting data, code and analysis for our recent manuscript on predicting rodent hepatotoxicity using chemical structure and bioactivity data (J. Liu, K. Mansouri, R. S. Judson, M. T. Martin, H. Hong, M. Chen, X. Xu, R. S. Thomas, and I. Shah, �??Predicting hepatotoxicity using ToxCast in vitro bioactivity and chemical structure,�?? Chem. Res. Toxicol., vol. 28, no. 4, pp. 738�??751, Apr. 2015). We implemented the machine learning approach described in this manuscript using Python and by relying extensively on the scikit-learn package. The analysis was conducted in an ipython notebook (now called jupyter).

EPA/usepa-harmonization.name: usepa-harmonization
EPA/usepa-harmonization.description:

The backend is a mongodb NoSQL database with a python mongoengine object-oriented interface. All data analysis and visualization is handled in python using Pandas, numpy, scipy and matplotlib.

EPA/Computational%20Sustainability.name: Computational Sustainability
EPA/Computational%20Sustainability.description: This is code written primarily in Java as part of the Computational Sustainability Pathfinder Innovation Project. This project is being developed in GitHub.

EPA/GREENSCOPE%20Tool.name: GREENSCOPE Tool
EPA/GREENSCOPE%20Tool.description:
The GREENSCOPE Microsoft Excel and JAVA version   software tools allow for quantifying process sustainability with 139 indicators in four main areas (or bases): Efficiency (26 indicators), Energy (14 indicators), Economics (33 indicators), and Environment (66 indicators). These sets of indicators are capable of transmitting and translating process performance, feedstock, utility, equipment, and output information into a quantifiable sustainability measurement scale. In addition, each indicator is mathematically defined, thus emphasizing realistic usage, and connecting the mathematical formulas for the indicators with their respective data requirements. 
 
GREENSCOPE can be applied to an entire process, to a piece of equipment or process unit, or at the investigatory bench scale. This versatility allows for a direct comparison between several processes manufacturing the same product but employing different raw materials, reaction processes, separation technologies, or producing different byproducts. In addition, the designer or the researcher can implement this methodology to evaluate the sustainability performance either before or after making process modifications. This resulting sustainability assessment describes quantifiably how well the system under consideration makes use of mass and energy inputs to manufacture a valuable product, at the same time meeting social and environmental needs, all the while maximizing its economic benefit.
  
Currently, the GREENSCOPE Microsoft Excel version software tool is under clearance in STICS. The JAVA version has been QA approved. A new standalone and web-based version is under development in GitHub (https://github.com/USEPA/greenscope).

EPA/StreamCat.name: StreamCat
EPA/StreamCat.description: The StreamCat Dataset (http://www2.epa.gov/national-aquatic-resource-surveys/streamcat) provides summaries of natural and anthropogenic landscape features for approximately 2.65 million streams, and their associated catchments, within the conterminous USA. This repo contains code used in StreamCat to process a suite of landscape rasters to watersheds for streams and their associated catchments (local reach contributing area) within the conterminous USA using the NHDPlus Version 2 as the geospatial framework.

EPA/Water%20Network%20Tool%20for%20Resil.description:
WNTR is a python package designed to simulate and analyze resilience of water distribution networks. The software includes capability to:
- Generate water network models
- Modify network structure and operations
- Add disruptive events including pipe leaks
- Add response/repair strategies
- Simulate pressure driven demand and demand driven hydraulics
- Simulate water quality
- Evaluate resilience
- Visualize results

EPA/SWMM-EPANET%20User%20Interface.name: SWMM-EPANET User Interface

SWMM is a dynamic hydrology-hydraulic water quality simulation model. It is used for single event or long-term (continuous) simulation of runoff quantity and quality from primarily urban areas. SWMM source code is written in the C Programming Language and released in the Public Domain.

EPA/CIMC%20Services%20Monitoring%20Scrip.name: CIMC Services Monitoring Script
EPA/CIMC%20Services%20Monitoring%20Scrip.description:
The Cleanups in My Community (CIMC) team has developed a services monitor script for the CIMC application.  This is a Python script that reads a CSV list of services required by the CIMC application.  For each service URL in the CSV, the script cycles through each data layer, and queries the map service to test that results are being returned.  If no results are returned, the script will email a list of services that did not respond to the query.  

The main requirements for this script are Python and an SMTP mail server connection.  Ideally the script would run every 2-3 hours to check the services availability.

The current thinking behind quickmapr is to allow for quick visualization of sp and raster objects.

EPA/Piscine%20Stream%20Community%20Estim.name: Piscine Stream Community Estimation System
EPA/Piscine%20Stream%20Community%20Estim.description: The Piscine Stream Community Estimation System (PiSCES) provides users with a reasonable fish community for any stream reach in the conterminous United States. PiSCES utilizes distributional information obtained from Nature Serve, the USGS, and the Peterson Field Guide to Freshwater Fishes of North America for over 1,000 native and non-native freshwater fish species. In addition to these geographic distributions, users of PiSCES can filter potential fish assemblages based on species rarity, stream size preferences (as measured by mean stream width), and genera-specific occurrence envelopes for a variety of physicochemical stream properties (pH, conductivity, turbidity, dissolved oxygen, watershed area, mean width, depth, and slope). For a user-specified total number of fishes in the stream reach, PiSCES will create an abundance distribution for the posited community using a size spectrum approach that relates abundance to maximum body size. The PiSCES interface allows users to readily access its database to see ancillary characteristics of each species, such as habitat preferences (e.g., if the species prefers riffles, runs, or pools, sand or gravel substrate, etc.) and HUC-based distribution maps. PiSCES has been used in conjunction with an integrated environmental modeling system to simulate dynamics of stream fish communities in the Coal River, WV watershed.

EPA/XCode%20Data%20Sample%20for%20Enviro.description: This sample will provide the steps to create a simple iOS application that can consume Radiation (RadNet) Data. The Envirofacts RadNet database contains sample results for a variety of radionuclides and radiation types from 200 monitoring stations across all 50 states and the American Territories.

EPA/ANDROID%20Multisystem%20Data%20Sampl.name: ANDROID Multisystem Data Sample Envirofacts API
EPA/ANDROID%20Multisystem%20Data%20Sampl.description: This API data sample will provide the steps to create a simple Android application that can consume EPA Envirofacts Multisystem Data. The Envirofacts Multisystem data is comprised of multiple environmental databases for facility information, including toxic chemical releases, water discharge permit compliance, hazardous waste handling processes, Superfund status, and air emission estimates.

EPA/Xcode%20RadNet%20Sample%20Envirofact.name: Xcode RadNet Sample Envirofacts API
EPA/Xcode%20RadNet%20Sample%20Envirofact.description: This sample will provide the steps to create a simple iOS application that can consume Radiation (RadNet) Data. The Envirofacts RadNet database contains sample results for a variety of radionuclides and radiation types from 200 monitoring stations across all 50 states and the American Territories.

EPA/FRS%20getfacilities%20samples.name: FRS getfacilities samples
EPA/FRS%20getfacilities%20samples.description: This repository contains sample HTML/JavaScript code to demonstrate the use of the EPA Facility Registry Service (FRS) GetFacilities REST API. The GetFacilities REST API can be used for a number of different types of applications, whether performing a radial search for EPA regulated facilities, or querying for facility information based on name and location, spatial query by radial search, or other types of scenarios. These have initially been developed to support the 2014 Exchange Network Conference, as simple code samples developed in a few hours and a few dozen lines of JavaScript. An additional resource sheet for the 2014 Exchange Network conference was developed and a MarkDown version is available here: https://github.com/USEPA/FRS-getfacilities-samples/blob/master/EN2014_Resources.md

EPA/IRIS-Trimethylbenzene-PBPK-.name: IRIS-Trimethylbenzene-PBPK-
EPA/IRIS-Trimethylbenzene-PBPK-.description: This project will be developed and stored in a GitHub repository. This will include the revisions after peer review to the PBPK model for the trimethylbenzene IRIS assessment.

EPA/NET-DfE%20Data%20Sample%20Envirofact.name: NET-DfE Data Sample Envirofacts API
EPA/NET-DfE%20Data%20Sample%20Envirofact.description: This API data sample will provide the steps to create a simple .Net Web application that can display EPA Design for the Environment (DfE) Data. The Envirofacts DfE data contains products EPA labeled environmentally friendly, so that consumers can easily choose ones that are safer for people and the environment.

EPA/share%20no%20cookies.name: share no cookies
EPA/share%20no%20cookies.description: Share no cookies is a pure JavaScript solution that allows you to easily share your page without any invasive tracking cookies. Includes posting to Facebook, Google+, Pinterest, and Twitter, as well as an explanatory page, "What is this?"

EPA/CompTox-Virtual-Tissues-ml-organ-tox.name: CompTox-Virtual-Tissues-ml-organ-tox
EPA/CompTox-Virtual-Tissues-ml-organ-tox.description: Can we use a data-driven approach to predict the target-organ toxicity of chemicals in repeat dose animal testing studies ? This project frame chemical toxicity prediction as a supervised machine learning (ML) problem. Toxicity is assumed to be a categorical outcome, which is defined by histopathology data from legacy repeat-dose animal testing experiments. Chemicals that cause/do not cause histopathological effects in an organ are treated as positive/negative examples of each class.

EPA/CompTox%20-%20Tipping%20point%20anal.name: CompTox - Tipping point analysis
EPA/CompTox%20-%20Tipping%20point%20anal.description: This file is a jupyter notebook describes how to conduct the analysis and recreate the figures given in: Shah I, Setzer RW, Jack J, Houck KA, Judson RS, Knudsen TB, Liu J, Martin MT, Reif DM, Richard AM, Thomas RS, Crofton KM, Dix DJ, Kavlock RJ. 2016. Using ToxCast�?� data to reconstruct dynamic cell state trajectories and estimate toxicological points of departure. Environ Health Perspect 124:910�??919.

EPA/EPANET-legacy-user-interface.description:
This repository contains source code for EPANET2W Delphi Windows application. The code is contained in the following folders:

components.zip -- Custom Delphi components that must be installed into the Delphi IDE's component palette before working with the GUI code. Files last updated on 7/5/06.

epanet2w.zip -- Borland Delphi code that comprises the graphical user interface (GUI) for the Windows version of EPANET 2. Should be compiled into an executable named epanet2w.exe for use with the EPANET program. Files last updated on 2/25/08.

EPA/VIVO%20Github%20Repository.name: VIVO Github Repository
EPA/VIVO%20Github%20Repository.description: VIVO is an open source semantic web application that enables the discovery of research and scholarship across disciplinary and geographic boundaries. ORD is currently developing a VIVO instance to assist with expertise location within ORD.  This github repository will be used to store ORD VIVO code as well as a means to share it amongst the ORD VIVO team and with other ORD VIVO instance project teams and developers (i.e. Cornell, UFL, USDA, etc.,)

GSA/pycsw.name: pycsw
GSA/pycsw.description: pycsw is an OGC CSW server implementation written in Python.  pycsw fully implements the OpenGIS Catalogue Service Implementation Specification [Catalogue Service for the Web]. Initial development started in 2010 (more formally announced in 2011). The project is certified OGC Compliant, and is an OGC Reference Implementation.  pycsw allows for the publishing and discovery of geospatial metadata. Existing repositories of geospatial metadata can also be exposed via OGC:CSW 2.0.2, providing a standards-based metadata and catalogue component of spatial data infrastructures.  pycsw is Open Source, released under an MIT license, and runs on all major platforms (Windows, Linux, Mac OS X).  Please read the docs at http://pycsw.org/docs for more information.

HUD/Geocoding%20Service%20Center.name: Geocoding Service Center
HUD/Geocoding%20Service%20Center.description: The Geocoding Service Center (GSC) is an enterprise tool providing address validation, standarization, and geocoding for 17 HUD systems. The GSC is a data repository for geographic information (USPS delivery point and ZIP9 data; Census data such as counties, localities, census tract, census block; MSA/CBSA; Longitude and latitude)  The GSC provides geographic information that can be used with mapping software to map locations such as HUD owned properties, underserved areas or national disaster areas.

HUD/Loan%20Accounting%20System.name: Loan Accounting System
HUD/Loan%20Accounting%20System.description: LAS, a mixed financial system, performs the direct loan servicing activities required to support the Department's Section 202 Supportive Housing for the Elderly Program, Section 201 Flexible Subsidy Program, Section 236 Excess Rental Income Program, the Green Retrofit Program and the Emergency Home Loan Program. The system maintains the loan amortization schedules, generates the monthly interest amounts due and principal amounts due, and applies collections to the interest and principal amounts due and all excess amounts are recorded in the project/loan suspense account.

HUD/HUD%20Procurement%20System.name: HUD Procurement System
HUD/HUD%20Procurement%20System.description: The HUD Procurement System (HPS) automates the contract procurement and acquisition process by recording, monitoring and reporting the status of all Actions throughout the procurement lifecycle.

HUD/HUD's%20Consolidated%20Financial%20S.name: HUD's Consolidated Financial Statement System
HUD/HUD's%20Consolidated%20Financial%20S.description: HCFSS, a mixed financial system, performs consolidation and analysis of cumulative data from HUD Central Accounting and Program System (HUDCAPS) on a monthly basis. Quarterly, HCFSS is used to generate HUD’s Governmentwide Treasury Account Symbol Adjusted Trial Balance System (GTAS) reports for submission to the Department of Treasury..

HUD/Single%20Family%20Insurance%20System.name: Single Family Insurance System
HUD/Single%20Family%20Insurance%20System.description: The Single Family Insurance System (SFIS) is the FHA repository of Single Family insured mortgages. SFIS is the system of record for all FHA insured Single Family loans and case records. There is one record for every active Single Family case and one record for each terminated case since 1984. Since October of 1983, Single Family Insurance System (SFIS) has been used to maintain the insurance-in-force (IIF) database, which contains accurate and detailed case information on FHA-insured single family properties.

HUD/Single%20Family%20Insurance%20System.name: Single Family Insurance System-Claims Subsystem
HUD/Single%20Family%20Insurance%20System.description: The Single Family Insurance Claim System provides on-line update and inquiry capability to Single Family Insurance and Claims data bases and to cumulative history files. .

HUD/Telephone%20Directory%20and%20Locato.name: Telephone Directory and Locator System
HUD/Telephone%20Directory%20and%20Locato.description: This system provides for the immediate update and retrieval of names, locations, organizations, and phone numbers of all personnel assigned to HUD headquarters. It is used to assist the locator personnel in responding to HUD directory assistance calls and to produce the HUD phone directory.

HUD/Line%20of%20Credit%20Control%20Syste.name: Line of Credit Control System
HUD/Line%20of%20Credit%20Control%20Syste.description: LOCCS, a mixed financial system, is a disbursement and cash management system that services 86 HUD Program Areas, 17,679 grantees, and controls payments for over 480,000 projects.

HUD/Inventory%20of%20Automated%20Systems.name: Inventory of Automated Systems
HUD/Inventory%20of%20Automated%20Systems.description: The Inventory of Automated Systems (IAS) keeps an inventory of the automated applications (or systems) which support business areas within the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD).

HUD/HUD%20Central%20Accounting%20and%20P.name: HUD Central Accounting and Program System
HUD/HUD%20Central%20Accounting%20and%20P.description: HUDCAPS is no longer the Department’s core financial system/system of record due to implementation of New Core Project Phase 1 Release 3. HUDCAPS now serves as a sub-ledger financial system and Oracle Federal Financials serves as the Department’s system of record and core financial system. The following types of transactions were migrated to Oracle Federal Financials: •Budget transactions (e.g., appropriation, apportionment, allotment, sub-allotment, and realignment) associated with all funds.

HUD/Personal%20Svcs%20Cost%20Rpt%20Subsy.name: Personal Svcs Cost Rpt Subsystem
HUD/Personal%20Svcs%20Cost%20Rpt%20Subsy.description: Personal Service Cost Report Subsystem (PSCRS) is used to support HUD's interfaces with the payroll system and acts as a batch processor/translator for HUD. PSCRS is a subsystem of HUD Central Accounting and Program System (HUDCAPS), the Department's general ledger.

HUD/Financial%20Data%20Mart.name: Financial Data Mart
HUD/Financial%20Data%20Mart.description: FDM, a mixed financial system, is a warehouse of data extracted from a variety of the Department's financial systems and supported by a number of query tools for the purpose of improved financial and program data reporting. FDM is the primary reporting tool used to generate internal ad–hoc reports, scheduled event driven reports, and queries.

HUD/Single%20Family%20Premium%20Collecti.name: Single Family Premium Collection Subsystem-Periodic
HUD/Single%20Family%20Premium%20Collecti.description: The Single Family Premiums Collection Subsystem - Periodic provides case-level reconciliation, premium billing, collection, reconciliation, refunding and accounting processes for the Single Family Insurance Operations Division of the Office of Financial Services. The system was implemented in September, 1999 as a replacement for A31/SFPC and incorporated the reconciliation functions performed by the contractor MGIC Independent Services. The system calculates monthly premiums due for the risk-based cases in the SFIS (A43) system, prepares monthly bills, reconciles and accounts for payments received, and provides data for monitoring lender performance.

HUD/Distributive%20Shares%20and%20Refund.name: Distributive Shares and Refund Subsystem
HUD/Distributive%20Shares%20and%20Refund.description: The Distributive Shares and Refund Subsystem (DSRS) was implemented in 1991 and replaced the F26 UNISYS system. It was designed in response to a Congressional mandate, in which a new method of collecting insurance premiums was established. Under this new method, a one-time mortgage insurance premium (OTMIP) is paid by the homeowner at closing to cover the life of the loan.

HUD/Single%20Family%20Premiums%20Collect.name: Single Family Premiums Collection Subsystem - Upfront
HUD/Single%20Family%20Premiums%20Collect.description: The SFPCS-U is an ongoing, fully operational financial system that supports HUD’s Single Family Insurance Operations Division (SFIOD). The A80R/SFPCS-U replaced the One-Time Mortgage Insurance Premium System. The system is tasked with the collection, reconciliation, and accounting of upfront mortgage insurance premiums (MIP) for FHA insured home loans. Insurance premiums are collected from borrowers at closing by mortgage lenders. A80R/SFPCS-U automates the collection of upfront mortgage insurance premiums from mortgage lenders through electronic funds transfer facilitated by the Treasury Department's Pay.Gov facility.

HUD/Single%20Family%20Acquired%20Asset%2.name: Single Family Acquired Asset Management System
HUD/Single%20Family%20Acquired%20Asset%2.description: The purpose of SAMS is to record all data associated with the daily maintenence of case records. It tracks movements of properties from acquisition to final sales closing using various data screens to move cases to steps. The system maintains all accounting data associated with the case records in accordance with the requirements of the Director, General Accounting Office (GAO), Department of the Treasury, Office of Manangement and Budget (OMB) and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP). SAMS is Year 2000 compliant in the storing and retrieving of data.

HUD/Single%20Family%20Neighborhood%20Wat.name: Single Family Neighborhood Watch
HUD/Single%20Family%20Neighborhood%20Wat.description: Single Family Neighborhood Watch (SFNW/A80W) was developed in response to Single Family Housing’s need for an analytical tool to aid the Department in monitoring FHA-approved lenders, HUD programs and loan performance by geographic area. SFNW also aids lenders and the public in self-policing the industry. As of November 13, 2013, there are 21,058 registered users plus the general public. Neighborhood Watch is a web browser-based risk assessment/decision support tool which identifies lenders, loan types, and locations by geographic areas that have high incidence of single family insured mortgages 30, 60 and 90 days delinquent within the first or second year from loan origination.

HUD/Program%20Accounting%20System.name: Program Accounting System
HUD/Program%20Accounting%20System.description: Program Accounting System (PAS) provides fund accountability and an integrated subsidiary for the Department's grant, subsidy, and loan programs. PAS maintains accounting records based on Commitment, Obligation, and Payment activity for HUD funding programs. PAS controls new program funds for Treasury Appropriation Accounts.

HUD/Integrated%20Disbursement%20%26%20In.name: Integrated Disbursement & Information System
HUD/Integrated%20Disbursement%20%26%20In.description: IDIS OnLine is a web-based grants management system used by CPD to automate administration of formula grants including CDBG, HOME, HOPWA, and ESG. IDIS also supports special grants established by the 2009 American Recovery and Reinvestment Act (ARRA) including TCAP, CDBG-R, and HPRP.

HUD/HUD%20Environmental%20Review%20Onlin.name: HUD Environmental Review Online System
HUD/HUD%20Environmental%20Review%20Onlin.description: The HUD Environmental Review Online System (HEROS) is a web-based module in HUD’s Integrated Disbursement & Information System (IDIS). HEROS computerizes the environmental review process and increases accountability and transparency for projects receiving HUD assistance. HEROS sends Environmental Review documents to OneCPD Resource Exchange website for accessibility by all parties.

HUD/CPD%20Grants%20Management%20Process.name: CPD Grants Management Process
HUD/CPD%20Grants%20Management%20Process.description: The Grants Management Process initiative provides support to the Department’s mission to help the nation’s communities meet their development needs; spur economic growth in distressed neighborhoods; provide housing assistance for the poor; help rehabilitate and develop moderate and low-cost housing, and enforce the nation’s fair housing laws. CPD is responsible for more than 20 programs, distributing close to $8 billion annually and manages more than 1,000 formula and competitive grantees across the nation.

HUD/Disaster%20Recovery%20Grant%20Report.name: Disaster Recovery Grant Reporting
HUD/Disaster%20Recovery%20Grant%20Report.description: DRGR is a web-based grants management application providing real-time financial disbursement, tracking, and reporting activities for HUD’s disaster grant programs. DRGR enables grantees to establish strategic plans, citizen participation plans, and action plans; draw program funds; and report on the activities, beneficiaries, properties, matching funds, and other accomplishment data. DRGR provides timely performance information regarding accomplishments achieved with use of program funds, pursuant to the Government Performance and Results Act of 1993 (GPRA) and program regulations.

HUD/Electronic%20Special%20Needs%20Assis.name: Electronic Special Needs Assistance Program System
HUD/Electronic%20Special%20Needs%20Assis.description: The COC Homeless Assistance program was enacted by the Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act (P.L. 100-77) of July 1987. e-snaps directly supports HUD's mission to decrease homelessness in America by improving how CPD staff manage the following CoC McKinney grant programs: 1) Subtitle C of Title IV Supportive Housing Programs (SHP), 24 CFR part 583; 2) Subtitle F of Title IV Shelter Plus Care (S+C), 24 CFR part 582; 3) Section 441, Single Room Occupancy (SRO), 24 CFR part 882. In May 2009, President Obama signed the Homeless Emergency Assistance and Rapid Transition to Housing (HEARTH) Act.

HUD/TitleV%20%2F%20BRAC.name: TitleV / BRAC
HUD/TitleV%20%2F%20BRAC.description: New Re-engineered TitleV 5.0 is a web-based J2EE application using Oracle database server as backend. The J2EE application server is Sun One Application Server 8.1.  The new TitleV 5.0 continues to track the surplus Federal properties as ordered by the Federal Court.  Title V 5.0 still contains property information on the properties reported to HUD by all Federal land holding agencies and is the vehicle for establishing the properties in the Federal Register.

HUD/Empowerment%20Zones%2FRenewal%20Comm.name: Empowerment Zones/Renewal Communities Performance Measurement System
HUD/Empowerment%20Zones%2FRenewal%20Comm.description: The need for a CPD Empowerment Zones/Renewal Communities systems (EZ/RC PERMS - C39) is based on work in partnership with States, regions, and localities to reduce unnecessary Federal paperwork, simplify Federal requirements, and reduce administrative burdens by consolidating and simplifying planning, application, and reporting requirements for EZ/RC awarded communities.

HUD/Administrative%20Client%20Request%2F.name: Administrative Client Request/Response System
HUD/Administrative%20Client%20Request%2F.description: The Administrative Client Request/Response System is an Office of Administrative and Management Services sponsored system that enables a HUD employee to request Administrative services from their desktop computer and have the request routed directly to the service provider.

HUD/Administrative%20National%20Services.name: Administrative National Services Supplies Request System
HUD/Administrative%20National%20Services.description: This system automates business processes used by HUD personnel to acquire the needed goods and services & to manage the tasks resulting from such requests. ANSRS supports HUD's internal customers allowing them to initiate electronic requests for services.

HUD/OHR%20Office%20of%20Personnel%20%26%.name: OHR Office of Personnel & Training Inquiry System
HUD/OHR%20Office%20of%20Personnel%20%26%.description: The purpose of this system is to provide the Office of Human Resources with personnel action information and updates which are provided by the National Financial Center's Payroll/Personnel System. It maintains SF-50 personnel data in perpetuity. The system records personnel actions which are used to produce EEO reports to meet the requirements of several Federal regulations.

HUD/Direct%20Distribution%20System%20Spe.name: Direct Distribution System SpectrumPlus
HUD/Direct%20Distribution%20System%20Spe.description: The Direct Distribution System SpectrumPlus DDS S+ is a Commercial-off-the-Shelf (COTS) package. The DDS S+ gives HUD employees, clients, and stakeholders the capability to request printed copies of documents and/or forms via the telephone, fax, or Internet. The system is used to distribute guidebooks, handbooks, forms, and literature to citizens, industry, employees, public housing authorities, and Governments that are required to comply with HUD regulations.  The Direct Distribution System powers the distribution center. The technology is used to enter orders, manage inventory, produce requisition tickets for pre-printed documents, and to print-on-demand (POD) documents that are digitized and produced when they are needed. DDS supports two units?the Customer Service Center (CSC) and the Fulfillment Center.

HUD/OCFO%20WebFocus%20CAP%20Reports%20Sy.name: OCFO WebFocus CAP Reports System
HUD/OCFO%20WebFocus%20CAP%20Reports%20Sy.description: A reporting tool that extracts data from multiple databases across multiple platforms to generate reports for the Program Areas and the OCFO Office of Budget. WebFocus environment allows the Program Areas and Office of Budget staff to use canned reports or produce their own reports by providing simple parameters already established using user-friendly screens. Data for the CAP reports is downloaded to the system biweekly through the Consolidated Cost & FTE Files (A91) Unisys mainframe. The WebFocus CAP reports are generated after the creation of consolidated files through the A91 system. The CAP reporting tool allows any valid user the ability to track personal services expenditures and FTE utilization.

HUD/HUD%20Client%20Information%20and%20P.name: HUD Client Information and Policy System
HUD/HUD%20Client%20Information%20and%20P.description: This system will provide HUD clients and staff with electronic access to the Department's regulations, policy directives, and procedures. The system will provide three levels of service as follows: Level I - The electronic distribution of new HUD documents. Level II - The full text search and retrieval capabilities of HUD directives. This level will replace the current Directives ìAccess System (DAS, D12). Level III - The capability for graphic search and retrieval. This will be integrated with all the capabilities of Level II. The services are currently provided by Drayton,Drayton & Lemar Inc., who provides HUDCLIPS as a service to HUD, HUD clients, and the general public. HUDCLIPS is sponsored by OAMS.

HUD/HUD%20Communication%20Manager.name: HUD Communication Manager
HUD/HUD%20Communication%20Manager.description: HCM allows for the quick generation and distribution of letters, labels, faxes, and reports from a customizable database. It uses RightFax for mass faxing. The name of the system was changed from ICS to HCM in 1999.

HUD/Equal%20Employment%20Opportunity%20M.name: Equal Employment Opportunity Management Information System
HUD/Equal%20Employment%20Opportunity%20M.description: The EEOMIS system is a web based system.

HUD/EZBudget%20Formulation%20System.name: EZBudget Formulation System
HUD/EZBudget%20Formulation%20System.description: EZBudget Formulation System (EZB) provides a streamlined and systematic approach to budget formulation for individual HUD Programs, HUD Salaries and Expenses and Jointly Administered Programs. It allows HUD to centralize, search, classify, control, and track information, and to simplify the budgetary development process. EZB provides a single source of budgetary information to the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) and budget data for justifications to Congress.

HUD/Single%20Family%20Housing%20Enterpri.name: Single Family Housing Enterprise Data Warehouse
HUD/Single%20Family%20Housing%20Enterpri.description: The D64A SFHEDW data warehouse resides on a virtual UNIX Server and uses Sybase IQ 15.2 as the primary Data Base Management System (DBMS) and Sybase ASE as a secondary DBMS for metadata. Some Source data from the legacy systems is edited and merged on the IBM mainframe server and formatted into files and loaded into the Unix Server. Many files are transferred by the source syard (FRB) 5. F51 - Institution Master File (IMF) - system replaced by data feed from P278 (LEAP) SFHEDW/D64A provides data to the following applications/entities: 1. A80W - Single Family Neighborhood Watch (SFNW) 2. A15 - Geocoding Service Center (GSC) 3. P013 - FHA Subsidiary Ledger (FHA-SL) 4. F17 - Computerized Homes Underwriting Management System (CHUMS). 5. P260 - Asset Disposition And Management System (ADAMS) - a.k.a. "Yardi" 6. A43 – Single Family Insurance System (SFIS) 7. P202 - Policy and Research Information Center (PARIS) 8. N/A - External - Loan Performance (Core Logic) data extracts 9. N/A - External - Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA) The following data marts and special tables are maintained in SFHEDW/D64A: 1. Appraiser Review System (ARS) 2. Claims 3. Defaults 4. Default Summary 5. Loan Limits 6. Generic Debt Management System (GDEBT) 7. Ginnie Mae (GNMA)(RESTRICTED ACCESS) 8. HUDStat 9. Home Equity Conversion Mortgage (HECM) 10. Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA) 11. Hope for Homeowners (H4H) 12. Integrated Database (IDB) 13. Loss Mitigation Portfolio Analysis (LMPA) 14. Natural disaster [formerly Hurricane Effort (2005)] 15. Public (reference tables) 16. Single Family Assets 17. Single Family Premium Collection System (SFPCS) 18. Single Family Real Estate Owned (REO) [formerly Property Disposition(SAMS)] 19. Title I 20. Special tables for Credit Scoring analysis (RESTRICTED ACCESS) 21. Metadata 22. Underwriting Reporting System (URS) In addition to the data marts listed above, there are the miscellaneous tables created for groups and/or offices like the OIG in Los Angeles and PD&R. A moving set of tables based on fiscal year data is also maintained to support the FHA Audit.

HUD/Facilities%20Asset%20Management%20En.name: Facilities Asset Management Enterprise System
HUD/Facilities%20Asset%20Management%20En.description: Proven web based asset management system, FAMES is a web based system that fully supports the Government property management business practices as defined by Government regulations and policies. It allows for optimal tracking and inventorying of agency wide personal property at HUD with the help of a mobile handheld scanner. FAMES also automate the reuse or disposal of assets. FAMES was designed as an enterprise system in order to help ensure success and reduce costs, HUD can leverage FAMES to interface with HUD General Ledger, the acquisition system PRISM, and with HIHRTS as source of data. Other HUD systems such as NEW CORE, ABS, and CHAMPS will need to be interfaced to automate HUD business process within FAMES. Note: This is an Azure cloud-based.

HUD/HATS%2FPERIS%20NFC%20FTP.name: HATS/PERIS NFC FTP
HUD/HATS%2FPERIS%20NFC%20FTP.description: Collects data from the National Finance Center. The data is used by several applications.

HUD/HUD%20Enterprise%20Geographic%20Info.name: HUD Enterprise Geographic Information System
HUD/HUD%20Enterprise%20Geographic%20Info.description: This system has 3 separate environments: development, test, and production. Each environment is identical from a hardware and software standpoint, comprising of one Windows web/application server and one Unix database server, for a total of 6 physical (not virtual) servers in all. The ESRI ArcGIS Server software is installed on the web/app tier along with IIS. The database tier houses an Oracle 11g database and ESRI ArcSDE software. Operation of the ArcGIS Server and geodatabase is currently maintained by staff in the Office of Policy Development and Research with assistance from HITS. The geodatabase is organized into different Oracle schemas, which are based on HUD program office or data theme. The user accounts that own these schemas are used by the geodatabase administrator to load and manage data. Applications that are built on the ArcGIS Server utilize a read only account to access the geodatabase.

HUD/HUD%20Empowerment%20Zone%2FRenewal%2.name: HUD Empowerment Zone/Renewal Community Locator
HUD/HUD%20Empowerment%20Zone%2FRenewal%2.description: The Empowerment Zone/Renewal Community Locator (EZ/RC Locator) is a web-based, Geographic Information System (GIS) application that helps businesses certify tax incentive eligibility within Empowerment Zones and Rural Community (EZ/RC) programs.

HUD/Single%20Family%20GIS.name: Single Family GIS
HUD/Single%20Family%20GIS.description: The Single Family Asset Management GIS System will be a customized implementation of a suite of COTS GIS applications. The primary COTS applications are ArcGIS Server and ArcSDE which already exist within the HUD enterprise architecture, these will be used for map creation and management. For address location, the Single Family Asset Management GIS System will use web software and a geocoder to capture an address and send the results to the application software. All other data will be stored in an Oracle database accessed by the application software. The Single Family Asset Management GIS System will then display a map of the selected area showing the user specified criteria, such as the REO properties and Revitalization Areas within a certain zip code.

HUD/HUD%20GIS%20Maps.name: HUD GIS Maps
HUD/HUD%20GIS%20Maps.description: The tool consists of five separate areas. Click on the appropriate button to access the map and details for any of the following purposesthat map: 1. Disaster Planning - This provides information regarding the potential impact of a disaster on HUD’s physical assets. 2. Public and Indian Housing - This provides information regarding public housing units. 3. Multifamily Project Evaluation - This provides information on multifamily units across the US.

HUD/CPD%20Maps.name: CPD Maps
HUD/CPD%20Maps.description: CPD Maps (D77D) is a major application that supports analysts in the HUD Office of Community Planning and Development (CPD), as well as the Internal Revenue Service, State and Local governments and the general public. Its main objective is to provide users, including federal, state and local agencies and the general public, with a geographical view of HUD program and community data, U.S. Census Bureau (2010) data, and American Community Survey (ACS) data.

HUD/Tribal%20Directory%20Assessment%20To.name: Tribal Directory Assessment Tool
HUD/Tribal%20Directory%20Assessment%20To.description: This system has 3 separate environments: development, test, and production. Each environment is identical from a hardware and software standpoint, comprising of one Windows web/application server and one Unix database server, for a total of 6 physical (not virtual) servers in all.

HUD/Affirmatively%20Furthering%20Fair%20.name: Affirmatively Furthering Fair Housing Data and Mapping Tool
HUD/Affirmatively%20Furthering%20Fair%20.description: The AFFHT is a sub-system of the Enterprise GIS Platform (eGIS). The eGIS is comprised of 3 separate environments: development, test, and production. Each environment is identical from a hardware and software standpoint, comprising of one Windows web/application server and one Unix database server, for a total of 6 virtual servers in all.

HUD/HUD%20Resource%20Locator.name: HUD Resource Locator
HUD/HUD%20Resource%20Locator.description: HRL is a sub-system of the Enterprise GIS Platform (eGIS). The eGIS is comprised of 3 separate environments: development, test, and production. Each environment is identical from a hardware and software standpoint, comprising of one Windows web/application server and one Unix database server, for a total of 6 virtual servers in all.

HUD/HUD%20Preservation%20Mapping%20Tool.name: HUD Preservation Mapping Tool
HUD/HUD%20Preservation%20Mapping%20Tool.description: PMT is a sub-system of the Enterprise GIS Platform (eGIS). The eGIS is comprised of 3 separate environments: development, test, and production.

HUD/HUD%20Community%20Assessment%20Repor.name: HUD Community Assessment Reporting Tool
HUD/HUD%20Community%20Assessment%20Repor.description: CART is a sub-system of the Enterprise GIS Platform (eGIS). The eGIS is comprised of 3 separate environments: development, test, and production.

HUD/Affirmatively%20Furthering%20Fair%20.name: Affirmatively Furthering Fair Housing User Interface Tool
HUD/Affirmatively%20Furthering%20Fair%20.description: HUD AFFH User Interface application is being developed as a Azure cloud-based secure application using Microsoft ASP.NET, SQL Server, and GIT tools. It is being made available to the HUD external and internal users via HUD Secure Systems (WASS) Portal. It also interfaces with the ESRI mapping service to allow HUD business partners to view fair housing related mapping data to help in completion of their AFH submissions.

HUD/eGIS%20Integrated%20Geodatabase%20an.name: eGIS Integrated Geodatabase and Map Services
HUD/eGIS%20Integrated%20Geodatabase%20an.description: This system has 3 separate environments: development, test, and production. Each environment is identical from a hardware and software standpoint, comprising of one Windows web/application server and one Unix database server, for a total of 6 physical (not virtual) servers in all.

HUD/HUD%20Application%20Release%20Tracki.name: HUD Application Release Tracking System
HUD/HUD%20Application%20Release%20Tracki.description: Some of the major features of the HARTS application are: - Tracks a request from submission through deployment with audit information - Ability to resubmit a request - New closeout feature records if a deployment was successful - Reports can be exported to Excel

HUD/Electronic%20Capital%20Planning%20In.name: Electronic Capital Planning Investment Control
HUD/Electronic%20Capital%20Planning%20In.description: eCPIC is the information Technology Investment Portfolio System, an innovative web-based Government-Off-The-Shelf (GOTS) decision support and project management application for managing information technology investments, as required by the Clinger Cohen Act of 1996 and OMB circular No. A-11; a tool that is used in conjunction with the Office of IT Reform's existing IT Capital Planning and Investment Process to strengthen and enhance the selection and management of IT projects.

HUD/Total%20Maintenance%20Management%20S.name: Total Maintenance Management System
HUD/Total%20Maintenance%20Management%20S.description: Total Maintenance Management System automates work orders, schedules preventive system aintenance, manages inventory and purchasing, and tracks equipment costs, labor usage, availability, and to meet contractural obligations.

HUD/Total%20Estimation%20%26%20Allocatio.name: Total Estimation & Allocation Mechanism - Resource Estimation & Allocation Process (TEAM-REAP)
HUD/Total%20Estimation%20%26%20Allocatio.description: Total Estimation and Allocation Mechanism (TEAM) captures workload accomplishments and time usage by HUD employees in support of Resource Estimation and Allocation Process (REAP) studies, HUD’s resource management process. The system was developed to link resources to results in compliance with Government Performance & Results Act (GPRA).

HUD/Section%203%20Performance%20Evaluati.name: Section 3 Performance Evaluation and Assessment Reporting System
HUD/Section%203%20Performance%20Evaluati.description: The SPEARS solution contains the following major components: This is the main application used by Authenticated users to submit the Section 60002 Form. It will contain the user interface (view) and application navigation. •SPEARS Business Registry Authenticated Application – This will allow HUD administrators to perform a variety of maintenance and auditing functions. •SPEARS Business Registry Public Application – SPEARS has a component that is accessible to the general public without any authentication, allowing users to register and search for Section 3 Businesses.

HUD/Housing%20Counseling%20System.name: Housing Counseling System
HUD/Housing%20Counseling%20System.description: The Housing Counseling System (HCS) is an automated web-based system to support HUD’s Single Family Housing Counseling Program. HCS has several components to collect data for reports and analysis. Three primary components are Agency information, HUD-9902 Report collection, and Grant Processing. The electronic form HUD-9902, Housing Counseling Agency Fiscal Year Activity Report, is available from the HUD web site for agencies to file their reports at the end of each fiscal year. HUD-approved housing counseling agencies, funded state housing finance agencies, and national and regional intermediaries and their funded affiliates are required to submit quarterly and annual HUD-9902 reports on their counseling activities. The 9902 component collects individual and aggregate HUD-9902 reports. HCS provides tools to track agency 9902 submissions and analysis of the data submitted. HUD users can request, by Homeownership Center or HUD-wide, a list of agencies that have reported, a list of those that have not reported, or cumulative totals of data.

HUD/Agency%20Reporting%20Module.name: Agency Reporting Module
HUD/Agency%20Reporting%20Module.description: ARM is a flexible and highly scalable data processing system based on Web Services technology Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP). There are three major components to the ARM processing: the client side which is managed and performed independently by the client deployed at the CMS system; authentication at the enterprise architecture level; and the server side which is the actual “core” of the ARM processing and web service processing.

HUD/Computerized%20Homes%20Underwriting%.name: Computerized Homes Underwriting Management System
HUD/Computerized%20Homes%20Underwriting%.description: This system assists and supports Field staff in the processing of single family mortgage insurance applications, from initial receipt through endorsement. Various types of applications are processed in CHUMS, including loans for First Time Homebuyers, Home Equity Conversion Mortgages (HECM) a reverse mortgage available to the elderly to augment income, substantial rehabilitation of existing properties, and VA Certified FHA loans. In addition to tracking and processing assistance, it provides automated assistance in appraisal and mortgage credit evaluation.

HUD/FHA%20Connection.name: FHA Connection
HUD/FHA%20Connection.description: The FHA Connection is an interactive system available through the Internet that gives approved FHA lenders real-time access to FHA systems for the purpose of conducting official FHA business in an electronic fashion. The FHA Connection is the Internet-based application used by FHA business partners to conduct official business with FHA. Applications available through the FHA Connection include Single Family underwriting, default reporting, portfolio management and others FHA programs.  As of April 1, 2008, 59,342 users from 22,425 institutions and branches have signed up to use the FHA Connection and average volume between 200,000 and 250,000 transactions per day. Updates to FHA Connection are explained and illustrated in the Latest Release Notes (Changes and Processing Instructions (CPIs)). The web page at http://hudatwork.hud.gov/po/h/hs/sys/chums/chumsf17.cfm

HUD/Integrated%20Real%20Estate%20Managem.name: Integrated Real Estate Management System
HUD/Integrated%20Real%20Estate%20Managem.description: The Integrated Real Estate Management System (iREMS) is a browser-based application, written in JAVA, and uses a J2EE-based client application connecting to an Oracle database management system. The database and application are maintained and executed on HUD’s Intranet Web Server/Application Server environment. Until all of the legacy applications scheduled to be integrated are rewritten to use the Oracle database, the legacy Housing Enterprise Real Estate Management System (HEREMS) Sybase database will be maintained as the integrated database of record.

HUD/Development%20Application%20Processi.name: Development Application Processing System
HUD/Development%20Application%20Processi.description: The DAP System provides the Office of Multifamily Housing the ability to administer multifamily housing programs throughout the various phases of construction and the review of processing for both the FHA insurance programs and section 202 (housing for elderly households) and 811 programs (housing for the disabled) application submissions.

HUD/Mark-To-Market.name: Mark-To-Market
HUD/Mark-To-Market.description: The purpose of the Mark-To-Market program is to test approaches that retain the critical affordable housing resource represented by the supply of 800,000 units of FHA-insured Section 8 assisted housing. It is HUD's objective to maintain this stock in good physical and financial condition, while at the same time reducing the cost of the ongoing Federal subsidy. The Mark-To-Market application supports the Mark-To-Market program by providing the following functionality: 1. A tracking module that captures basic information on the property and where it is in the restructuring process. 2. A financial model that tracks underwriting analysis and scenario information and calculates the anticipated outcome of the restructuring process. 3. A means to track third parties (i.e., Joint Venture Partners and Housing Finance Agencies) working with HUD to restructure the subsidy deal. 4. Various reports.

HUD/HEREMS%20Field%20Office%20Reporting%.name: HEREMS Field Office Reporting Utility
HUD/HEREMS%20Field%20Office%20Reporting%.description: The HEREMS Field Office Reporting Utility is a MS Access application that uses data downloaded from the Real Estate Management System (REMS)to produce reports for tracking and monitoring properties and Contract Administrators

HUD/Active%20Partners%20Performance%20Sy.name: Active Partners Performance System
HUD/Active%20Partners%20Performance%20Sy.description: The APPS is designed to support the Departmental business functions covered by the management plan for the re-engineered HUD-2020. The system serves as a replacement for the current Previous Participation Review System (PPRS-F19). It is a state-of-the-art computer automated process designed with a single web-based integrated database, retrievable/changeable via Internet/Intranet. The database contains industry characteristic and business data submitted on form HUD-2530 by industry participants, via the Internet, for Certification to participate in HUD's multifamily housing program project activity (includes data of previous participation wih HUD and other Federal Government Agencies). The APPS automated functionality also includes the Intranet HUD staff's review and approval process of the form HUD-2530 submissions.

HUD/Consolidated%20Single%20Family%20Sta.name: Consolidated Single Family Statistical System
HUD/Consolidated%20Single%20Family%20Sta.description: CSFSS/F42 system is required to supply CSFSS statistical information in several formats based on criteria on a daily basis. This system will support efforts to define detailed CSFSS data types and create the required data sets to meet statistical reporting for customer needs. This data is requested year around by various agencies and private sector. But the primary function is to provide statistical data for HUD Headsquarters proram staff for disission making functions.

HUD/Single%20Family%20Default%20Monitori.name: Single Family Default Monitoring Subsystem
HUD/Single%20Family%20Default%20Monitori.description: The Single Family Default Monitoring System is a subsystem of F42. When a mortgage is 90 or more days delinquent, the Mortgagee or Servicer must submit a Single Family Form 92068-a to HUD on a monthly basis until its status has been completed by all Mortgagees and/or is terminated or deleted. Mortgagees and Servicers provide default data via Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) or using the WEB via FHA connection to HUD where they are sorted, pre-screened, key entered, edited, processed and reports are generated for HUD Headquarters and Field Offices review.

HUD/Institution%20Master%20File.name: Institution Master File
HUD/Institution%20Master%20File.description: The Institution Master File (IMF) formerly maintained the official record of institutions (Title I lenders and Title II mortgagees) that are approved by HUD/FHA to originate, service or invest in FHA insured mortgages or loans. IMF centralized institution data needed for the operation of FHA’s home mortgage, project mortgage and home improvement loan insurance programs.

HUD/Approval%20%26%20Recertification%20T.name: Approval & Recertification Tracking System
HUD/Approval%20%26%20Recertification%20T.description: ARRTS is the primary workload management system for Office of Lender Activities and Program Compliance (OLAPC) staff at Headquarters and Quality Assurance Division staff in the four Home Ownership Centers (HOCs). The system provides for a centralized point of access for users to document each stage in the approval and re-authorization process for lenders applying for or renewing their authorization to participate in FHA's programs as well as each step taken to identify and remedy FHA program violations. Use of a single platform for managing workflow between Headquarters and the HOCs and across the three divisions in OLAPC provides for uniformity in data collection on all aspects of work performed and a critical framework for identifying, prioritizing and mitigating risk from 3,600 FHA-approved Lenders.

HUD/Quality%20Assurance%20Document%20Lib.name: Quality Assurance Document Library System
HUD/Quality%20Assurance%20Document%20Lib.description: The Quality Assurance Document Library System (QDLS) is a web-based document repository used by the Quality Assurance Division (QAD) at HUD Headquarters and its counterparts in the four Home Ownership Centers (HOCs). The application serves as a central location for QAD staff across the country to store final imaged documents generated as a result of compliance monitoring reviews, OIG audits, and referrals. The application also serves as a resource for QAD staff to access internal reference guides and policies, as well as the standard templates used for conducting monitoring reviews, and generating correspondence.

HUD/Credit%20Alert%20Verification%20Repo.name: Credit Alert Verification Reporting System
HUD/Credit%20Alert%20Verification%20Repo.description: The F57/CAIVRS application resides on multiple platforms: The user interface is on the Internet GSS and the databases are on the UNISYS mainframe GSS. CAIVRS database resides on a Unisys/Dorado mainframe server and includes COBOL programs, TIP Screens, DMS 1100 and RDMS 1100 databases. (Note that the TIP screens are no longer used.) The CAIVRS web interface is part of HUD’s F17C/FHA Connection, which is an Internet-based application.   Originally, CAIVRS automated screening was done only through a touch-tone telephone system using a succession of voice response units (VRUs). CAIVRS was created in 1988 for the Office of Housing to check the credit worthiness of applicants for FHA insured loans. Title 31, United States Code, Section 3720B bars “delinquent Federal debtors from obtaining Federal loans or loan insurance guarantees.” In 1989, the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) mandated that all Federal Credit agencies prescreen all applicants for non-delinquency in Federal debt, through a system of shared data, where practical. In 1990, CAIVRS expanded to include delinquent Federal borrower data from agencies other than HUD, including; USDA, VA, SBA, FDIC, and the Departments of Education and Justice.  HUD receives data and has Computer Matching agreements and Interagency Agreements with the following Federal Agencies: 1. USDA - United States Department of Agriculture a. RURAL HOUSING b. FARM SERVICES 2. SBA - Small Business Administration, 3. VA - Veterans Administration, 4. DOED - Department of Education, a. Guaranteed B. CAIVRS/F57 receives data from the following Single Family legacy systems and other HUD organizations. 1. A43C Single Family Insurance Claims System (CLAIMS) 2. F42D Single Family Default Monitoring System (SFDMS) 3. P278 Lender Electronic Assessment Portal (LEAP-IM)-[replaced F51/IMF - May 2014] 4. F71 Debt Collection and Asset Management System - Title I (DCAMS-T1) 5. F71A Debt Collection and Asset Management System - Generic Debt (DCAMS-GD) 6. A21 Loan Accounting System (LAS) -HUD CFO delinquent borrower reporting C. CAIVRS/F57 provides data to the following Single Family systems 1. F17 Computerized Homes Underwriting Management System (CHUMS)

HUD/Debt%20Collection%20and%20Asset%20Ma.name: Debt Collection and Asset Management System - Title I
HUD/Debt%20Collection%20and%20Asset%20Ma.description: The Debt Collection and Asset Management System is used to monitor and collect defaulted Title I loans for which a claim has been filed by the lender and has been subsequently paid by HUD. The system handles all the collection functions including all the financial activities, billing and dunning, credit bureau reporting, referral of debts to Treasury as required under the Debt Collection Improvement Act (DCIA), 1098 and 1099-C reporting to the IRS, processing collection files from a number of sources.

HUD/Debt%20Collection%20and%20Asset%20Ma.name: Debt Collection and Asset Management System - Generic Debt
HUD/Debt%20Collection%20and%20Asset%20Ma.description: The Debt Collection and Asset Management System - Generic Debt is used to monitor and collect delinquent FHA receivables. The system handles all the collection functions including all the financial activities, billing and dunning, credit bureau reporting, referral of debts to Treasury as required under the Debt Collection Improvement Act (DCIA), 1098 and 1099-C reporting to the IRS, processing collection files from a number of sources.

HUD/Title%20I%20Insurance%20and%20Claims.name: Title I Insurance and Claims
HUD/Title%20I%20Insurance%20and%20Claims.description: The Title I Insurance and Claims System (TIIS) provides operational and management support for the xecution of the Title I Property Improvement, including FHA PowerSaver, and Manufactured Home Loan programs. It provides online inquiry and updating to support day-to-day operations. This includes loan inventory, maintenance, billing, premium collection and reconcilement, claim processing, and Title I Reserves, maintenance and accounting.

HUD/Tenant%20Rental%20Assistance%20Certi.name: Tenant Rental Assistance Certification System
HUD/Tenant%20Rental%20Assistance%20Certi.description: TRACS is a mainframe systemimplemented for receiving and maintaining Tenant Certification Data. TRACS was enhanced to become the official repository for Multifamily Housing’s Rental Assistance Project Based Contracts. TRACS was also enhanced to receive, monitor, and process Voucher Payments. TRACS continues to be enhanced to provide additional support to the Office of Multifamily Housing to monitor and report Multifamily Rental Assistance Project Based activities. TRACS consists of four (4) primary business systems – the Contract Business System, Tenant Business System, the Voucher/Payment Business System, and the file transfer system, the integrated Multifamily Access Exchange System (iMax). Within these four (4) business systems, eight (8) significant subsystems comprise and provide specialized functionality: •Integrated Contracts (iCon) is a browser-based (J2EE) subsystem that supports the MFH rental assistance repository. •Automated Renewal and Amendment Management Subsystem (ARAMS) is a browser-based subsystem that supports HUD funding functions for contract renewals and amendments. •Tenant Address Subsystem maintains the repository of tenant unit and mailing addresses to support those HUD applications requiring the ability to locate the tenant’s physical location or mail a document to their mailing address. This repository is currently a resource for the Real Estate Assessment Center (REAC) applications. •Tenant On-Line System provides HUD staff with extensive query capability against the Tenant database together with the ability to order over a dozen different management reports on contracts or projects. •Tenant Internet/Intranet Query provides HUD staff and owners, agents, and CAs (Internet) with secure access to current tenant data for those contracts and projects they are authorized to review. •Voucher Internet/Intranet Query provides HUD staff and owners, agents, and CAs with a secure access to view the most recent 12-months of Voucher activity for those contracts (projects for Rent Supplement and Rental Assistance Program (RAP)) that they are authorized to view. This query enables owners and management agents to check on the status of their own vouchers. •Voucher Internet/Intranet Detail Reports provides HUD staff and owners, agents and CAs downloadable reports similar to the 52670-A Part 1. Triggered by the receipt of a voucher and using the TRACS Tenant database, TRACS will generate the regular payment and the adjustment sections of 52670-A Part 1.

HUD/Real%20Estate%20Assessment%20Center%.name: Real Estate Assessment Center System
HUD/Real%20Estate%20Assessment%20Center%.description: This application utility is becoming the one umbrella of all PIH-REAC computer applications, using the latest technologyand allowing easy interface between HUD HQ, its FO's, Public Housing Authority, Multifamily Owners and Agent, Inspectors and Lender.

HUD/Enterprise%20Master%20Data%20Managem.name: Enterprise Master Data Management Solution
HUD/Enterprise%20Master%20Data%20Managem.description: The EMDM will be a repository of all master data entities with in HUD. It must have functionality to create, manage, maintain and use data in the data warehouse. These functionalities can be grouped into three main categories/components: • Data Load: Extract data from source systems, transfer data to staging area, verify data quality and match data from different sources. • Data warehousing: Correlate, de-normalize and aggregate data. • Reporting: Allow end users to access and retrieve data in the data warehouse, perform analysis, create reports and use data mining tools.

HUD/Multifamily%20Housing%20Development%.name: Multifamily Housing Development Coordination Service
HUD/Multifamily%20Housing%20Development%.description: This project team is the Development Coordination Group (DCG) for all Multifamily Housing using HUD's Internet/Intranet Web-based application architecture (currently Coldfusion/J2EE/Sybase). The project directly supports the database integration and development coordination for the following Multifamily Housing system applications listed by PCAS: · 251460--APPS -Active Partners Performance System · 251780--ARAMS- Automated Amendment and Renewal System · 251850--M2M -Mark-to-Market System · 251840--MDDR -Multifamily Default and Delinquency Reporting system · 251330--MFCS -Multifamily Claims System · 251760--REMS -Real Estate Management System · 251780--TRACS -Tenant Rental Assistance Certification System (Intranet/Internet side only)  The highest priority for the project is the integration of data, infrastructure and processes for all current and future systems that utilize Multifamily Housing data.
